intro: Lophanthera marcelae, commonly known as the Marcel's mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes grown in gardens, though it is not widely cultivated commercially.
